column4: anyone in here experienced with jackd, qsynth and playing with a midi keyboard in standalone? i could really use some help here. this keyboard is driving me nuts....
I used to get jackd to work but only as sudo to start
been a while but i ran something like patch
I used the keyboard software that interfaces the leter keys to the midi events to test it
I don't have a midi keyboard just the keyboard on my computer
I used it to test the sounds of drum synths and stuf
I think timidity starts at boot but can start it from the terminal
yes timidity converts midi files to sound
no jackd is more like a sound mixer
timidity simulates a synthisizer with midi events it creates sounds
you can use your keyboard to create the events to play it
the patch panel will be the gui part to route your midi events to the instruments you want to play
best take this offline this is not ubuntu related
